{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Media Sales Executive",
  "description": "KOKO TV is a fast growing music production company, based at London&rsquo;s iconic music venue, KOKO. Founded in 2010, we have quickly established ourselves as a major player in the youth music market.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Media Sales Executive

Job Location: Lagos
Job type:&nbsp;Full-Time

About the Job


	We are recruiting for the role of Media Sales Eecutive to join our team.
	The ideal candidate will have experience in all stages of the sales cycle.
	They should be confident with building new client relationship and maintaining existing ones.
	They should have evidence of strong skills and possess good negotiation skills.


Responsibilities


	Business Development: Identify and pursue new sales opportunities to grow portfolio and generate new revenue streams with agencies and clients direct.
	Account Management: Proactively manage accounts, ensuring the delivery of high-quality service, timely solutions, and maintaining strong, long-lasting relationships.
	Revenue Growth: Demonstrate a proven ability to consistently meet and exceed sales targets, showcasing YOY growth.
	Client Engagement: Serve as the main point of contact for clients, with excellent presentation skills and able to build and maintain strong relationships through emails, meetings and entertainment.
	Collaboration: Work closely with internal teams to ensure the successful execution of campaigns and solutions.
	Reporting: Regularly update sales pipeline on CRM, track progress, and forecast future business to management.


Qualifications


	Bachelor&#39;s Degree or equivalent experience in Business with&nbsp;4+ years&#39; of sales experience
	Excellent written and verbal communication skills.


Key Requirements:


	Experience: 4+ years of media experience preferred and 2+ years of sales experience preferred.
	Agency-Focused: With a portfolio of established accounts with media agencies as well as a large portfolio of prospective clients. You&rsquo;re able to provide a track record that shows YOY growth.
	Proactive and Driven: You&rsquo;re innovative and energetic, creating strategy, selling, meeting new people and winning new business.
	Collaboration: You enjoy collaborating with internal teams to ensure the successful execution of campaigns, content and solutions.
	Communication Skills: Clients enjoy working with you, you&rsquo;re concise and you deliver compelling solutions that solve their business needs, with the ability to present and negotiate at all levels.
	Organised and Detail-Oriented: You know your CRM pipeline and maintain it to track progress, forecasting, achieve your goals and forecast future business to management.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Applications with their CV attached to:&nbsp;careers@kokointernet.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email",
  "datePosted": "2025-09-02",
  "validThrough": "2025-10-01",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "KOKO TV Nigeria"
    
  },

    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",

       "streetAddress": ". ",
      "addressLocality": "Lagos",
      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },
  "identifier": {
    "@type": "PropertyValue",
    "name": "",
    "value": "186713"
  },
  "baseSalary": {
    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",
    "currency": "NGN",
    "value": {
      "@type": "QuantitativeValue",
      "minValue": 0,
      "maxValue": 0,
      "unitText": "MONTH"
    }
  }
}



Media Sales Executive Job at KOKO TV




        
    

        
        KOKO TV is a fast growing music production company, based at London’s iconic music venue, KOKO. Founded in 2010, we have quickly established ourselves as a major player in the youth music market.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Media Sales Executive

Job Location: Lagos
Job type: Full-Time

About the Job
     

            
    




	We are recruiting for the role of Media Sales Eecutive to join our team.
	The ideal candidate will have experience in all stages of the sales cycle.
	They should be confident with building new client relationship and maintaining existing ones.
	They should have evidence of strong skills and possess good negotiation skills.


Responsibilities


	Business Development: Identify and pursue new sales opportunities to grow portfolio and generate new revenue streams with agencies and clients direct.
	Account Management: Proactively manage accounts, ensuring the delivery of high-quality service, timely solutions, and maintaining strong, long-lasting relationships.
	Revenue Growth: Demonstrate a proven ability to consistently meet and exceed sales targets, showcasing YOY growth.
	Client Engagement: Serve as the main point of contact for clients, with excellent presentation skills and able to build and maintain strong relationships through emails, meetings and entertainment.
	Collaboration: Work closely with internal teams to ensure the successful execution of campaigns and solutions.
	Reporting: Regularly update sales pipeline on CRM, track progress, and forecast future business to management.


Qualifications


	Bachelor's Degree or equivalent experience in Business with 4+ years' of sales experience
	Excellent written and verbal communication skills.


Key Requirements:


	Experience: 4+ years of media experience preferred and 2+ years of sales experience preferred.
	Agency-Focused: With a portfolio of established accounts with media agencies as well as a large portfolio of prospective clients. You’re able to provide a track record that shows YOY growth.
	Proactive and Driven: You’re innovative and energetic, creating strategy, selling, meeting new people and winning new business.
	Collaboration: You enjoy collaborating with internal teams to ensure the successful execution of campaigns, content and solutions.
	Communication Skills: Clients enjoy working with you, you’re concise and you deliver compelling solutions that solve their business needs, with the ability to present and negotiate at all levels.
	Organised and Detail-Oriented: You know your CRM pipeline and maintain it to track progress, forecasting, achieve your goals and forecast future business to management.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Applications with their CV attached to: careers@kokointernet.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Digital Marketer",
  "description": "Biz Afric Solutions -&nbsp;Our Client is a fast growing Hair Brand known for Quality Human Hair Weaves, Hair Accessories and crafting exquisite custom braided wigs for trendy, beautiful and elegant women worldwide.

They offer premium human hair extensions and handcrafted braided wigs designed to elevate your look and boost your confidence.

They are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Digital Marketer

Job Location:&nbsp;Remote
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Overview


	We are seeking a talented and passionate Digital Marketer to join our dynamic team.
	As a Digital Marketer, you will play a crucial role in driving our online presence and generating leads through effective digital marketing strategies.
	You will be responsible for developing and executing comprehensive digital marketing campaigns across various channels, including social media, email marketing, search engine optimization (SEO)


Job Description


	Develop and execute comprehensive marketing campaigns to promote our services and initiatives.
	Winning deals, nurturing them and growing the company&#39;s revenue
	Ensure lead Generation and Conversion
	Maintain accurate and up-to-date records in the CRM system.
	Fully exploit digital marketing tools to drive growth
	Form collaborations with micro and major influencers
	Contribute to content creation for marketing through various channels including blog posts
	Contribute to the management of website orders and website live agent
	Monitor, analyze, and report on digital performance, for marketing and branding strategy success
	Seeking relevant associations and partnerships relevant to the business&rsquo; growth
	Seeking grant funding for the organization


Requirements


	Education: Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Marketing, Business Administration, Communications, or a related field.
	3 years of experience in growth, business development, content marketing or growth-focused digital role.
	Female applicants preferable.
	Proven experience in social media management, content development, and digital campaign execution.
	Experience with lead generation and CRM management is highly desirable.
	Strong understanding of digital marketing strategies and tools.
	Proficiency in using digital marketing platforms such as Google Analytics, Google Ads, social media management tools, and email marketing software.
	Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
	Analytical mindset with the ability to interpret data and provide actionable insights.
	Creativity and innovation in developing digital content and campaigns.
	Strong organizational and project management skills.
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment.


Key Competencies:


	Strategic thinking and planning
	Creativity and innovation
	Analytical and problem-solving skills
	Strong communication and interpersonal skills
	Attention to detail and accuracy
	Adaptability and flexibility.


Salary
N110,000 - N120,000 / Month",

  "validThrough": "2025-10-01",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",

    "@type": "Organization",

  },

      "minValue": 75000,

Digital Marketer Job at Biz Afric Solutions




        
    

        
        Biz Afric Solutions - Our Client is a fast growing Hair Brand known for Quality Human Hair Weaves, Hair Accessories and crafting exquisite custom braided wigs for trendy, beautiful and elegant women worldwide.

They offer premium human hair extensions and handcrafted braided wigs designed to elevate your look and boost your confidence.

They are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Digital Marketer

Job Location: Remote
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Overview
     

            
    




	We are seeking a talented and passionate Digital Marketer to join our dynamic team.
	As a Digital Marketer, you will play a crucial role in driving our online presence and generating leads through effective digital marketing strategies.
	You will be responsible for developing and executing comprehensive digital marketing campaigns across various channels, including social media, email marketing, search engine optimization (SEO)


Job Description


	Develop and execute comprehensive marketing campaigns to promote our services and initiatives.
	Winning deals, nurturing them and growing the company's revenue
	Ensure lead Generation and Conversion
	Maintain accurate and up-to-date records in the CRM system.
	Fully exploit digital marketing tools to drive growth
	Form collaborations with micro and major influencers
	Contribute to content creation for marketing through various channels including blog posts
	Contribute to the management of website orders and website live agent
	Monitor, analyze, and report on digital performance, for marketing and branding strategy success
	Seeking relevant associations and partnerships relevant to the business’ growth
	Seeking grant funding for the organization


Requirements


	Education: Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business Administration, Communications, or a related field.
	3 years of experience in growth, business development, content marketing or growth-focused digital role.
	Female applicants preferable.
	Proven experience in social media management, content development, and digital campaign execution.
	Experience with lead generation and CRM management is highly desirable.
	Strong understanding of digital marketing strategies and tools.
	Proficiency in using digital marketing platforms such as Google Analytics, Google Ads, social media management tools, and email marketing software.
	Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
	Analytical mindset with the ability to interpret data and provide actionable insights.
	Creativity and innovation in developing digital content and campaigns.
	Strong organizational and project management skills.
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment.


Key Competencies:


	Strategic thinking and planning
	Creativity and innovation
	Analytical and problem-solving skills
	Strong communication and interpersonal skills
	Attention to detail and accuracy
	Adaptability and flexibility.


Salary
N110,000 - N120,000 / Month    

    

        Click here to Apply

  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Chief Engineer",
  "description": "Hilton is the leading global hospitality company, spanning the lodging sector from luxurious full-service hotels and resorts to extended-stay suites and mid-priced hotels. For nearly a century, Hilton has offered business and leisure travelers the finest in accommodations, service, amenities and value. Hilton is dedicated to continuing its tradition of providing exceptional guest experiences across its global brands. Our vision to fill the earth with the light and warmth of hospitality unites us as a team to create remarkable hospitality experiences around the world every day. And our amazing Team Members are at the heart of it all.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Chief Engineer

Job ID:&nbsp;HOT0BQ8V
Job Location:&nbsp;Maitama, Abuja

Description


	As a Chief Engineer, you will manage all engineering operations including building, plants, heating and cooling system (HVAC), plumbing, water treatment, boilers systems, etc.
	Manage effective performance of Engineering team in line with the department objectives and key performance indicators.


What will I be doing?


	As Chief Engineer, you are responsible for the effective management of all engineering and maintenance operations within the hotel, including energy conservation.
	You are also responsible for the development of the Engineering Team and staying abreast of compliance regulations and procedures in the field of Engineering, as required for hotel standards.


Specifically, a Chief Engineer will perform the following tasks to the highest standards:


	Lead the Engineering Team in the day-to-day engineering and maintenance operations of the hotel, including service standards, equipment schedules, and work schedules
	Communicate with Housekeeping to coordinate and prioritize maintenance activities for Guest rooms and public areas
	Develop systems and procedures to ensure the health and safety of Guests and Team Members, as well as the proper conditions for plants, machinery, and property
	Communicate with Government agencies to ensure full compliance with statutory regulations
	Prepare Capital and Repairs and Maintenance budgets for Engineering
	Develop and implement preventive maintenance plan.
	Supervise, develops and maintains an ongoing maintenance operation for hotel, including refrigeration, heating, plumbing, water treatment, preventive maintenance, hotel rooms, air/heating units, ice machines, swimming pools, lighting, kitchen equipment, emergency generators, water softeners, switch rooms, roof exhausts, electrical substations, etc.
	Conduct lift emergency release procedures as required
	Ensure good relationships are built with internal and external customers.
	Maintenance of all hotel fixtures and fittings to ensure they are in safe condition and take action when any unsafe situations arise
	Develop, implement, and direct all emergency programs
	Develop, implement and manage energy conservation programs for the property to minimize expenses
	Coordinate renovation bidding, define the cost and scope of the project, and oversee the general contractor and subcontractors to ensure quality work is performed cost effectively
	Perform special projects and other responsibilities as assigned
	Identify and introduce environmentally-friendly systems and equipment
	Monitor Key Performance Indicators for the Engineering Department and take corrective action, as required, to improve equipment inventory, quality audit, productivity, and other objectives
	Manage all Team Member related activities, including recruitment, performance management, training, career planning, disciplinary matters, and team motivation.
	Maintain the physical appearance and operational efficiency of the hotel including physical, mechanical, electrical, plumbing etc.


What are we looking for?


	A Chief Engineer serving Hilton brands is always working on behalf of our Guests and working with other Team Members.


Qualifications
To successfully fill this role, you should maintain the attitude, behaviours, skills, and values that follow:


	A Master`s degree in Engineering or similar
	Advanced knowledge of building management/engineering
	Exposure to budgeting and basic accounting
	Positive attitude
	Good communication skills
	Committed to delivering a high level of customer service
	Strong leadership skills and previous experience of managing a team
	Excellent grooming standards
	Flexibility to respond to a range of different work situations
	Ability to work under pressure
	Ability to work on their own
	Previous experience of facilities management
	Proficient, at an advanced level, with computers and relevant computer programs.


It would be advantageous in this position for you to demonstrate the following capabilities and distinctions:


	Diploma CFPA Europe Fire Safety
	Certified Engineering Operation Executive (CEOE)
	Master Certificate in Applied Project Management
	Certificate in Advance Strategic Project Management Practices.
",

Chief Engineer Job at Hilton Worldwide




        
    

        
        Hilton is the leading global hospitality company, spanning the lodging sector from luxurious full-service hotels and resorts to extended-stay suites and mid-priced hotels. For nearly a century, Hilton has offered business and leisure travelers the finest in accommodations, service, amenities and value. Hilton is dedicated to continuing its tradition of providing exceptional guest experiences across its global brands. Our vision to fill the earth with the light and warmth of hospitality unites us as a team to create remarkable hospitality experiences around the world every day. And our amazing Team Members are at the heart of it all.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Chief Engineer
     

            
    



Job ID: HOT0BQ8V
Job Location: Maitama, Abuja

Description


	As a Chief Engineer, you will manage all engineering operations including building, plants, heating and cooling system (HVAC), plumbing, water treatment, boilers systems, etc.
	Manage effective performance of Engineering team in line with the department objectives and key performance indicators.


What will I be doing?


	As Chief Engineer, you are responsible for the effective management of all engineering and maintenance operations within the hotel, including energy conservation.
	You are also responsible for the development of the Engineering Team and staying abreast of compliance regulations and procedures in the field of Engineering, as required for hotel standards.


Specifically, a Chief Engineer will perform the following tasks to the highest standards:


	Lead the Engineering Team in the day-to-day engineering and maintenance operations of the hotel, including service standards, equipment schedules, and work schedules
	Communicate with Housekeeping to coordinate and prioritize maintenance activities for Guest rooms and public areas
	Develop systems and procedures to ensure the health and safety of Guests and Team Members, as well as the proper conditions for plants, machinery, and property
	Communicate with Government agencies to ensure full compliance with statutory regulations
	Prepare Capital and Repairs and Maintenance budgets for Engineering
	Develop and implement preventive maintenance plan.
	Supervise, develops and maintains an ongoing maintenance operation for hotel, including refrigeration, heating, plumbing, water treatment, preventive maintenance, hotel rooms, air/heating units, ice machines, swimming pools, lighting, kitchen equipment, emergency generators, water softeners, switch rooms, roof exhausts, electrical substations, etc.
	Conduct lift emergency release procedures as required
	Ensure good relationships are built with internal and external customers.
	Maintenance of all hotel fixtures and fittings to ensure they are in safe condition and take action when any unsafe situations arise
	Develop, implement, and direct all emergency programs
	Develop, implement and manage energy conservation programs for the property to minimize expenses
	Coordinate renovation bidding, define the cost and scope of the project, and oversee the general contractor and subcontractors to ensure quality work is performed cost effectively
	Perform special projects and other responsibilities as assigned
	Identify and introduce environmentally-friendly systems and equipment
	Monitor Key Performance Indicators for the Engineering Department and take corrective action, as required, to improve equipment inventory, quality audit, productivity, and other objectives
	Manage all Team Member related activities, including recruitment, performance management, training, career planning, disciplinary matters, and team motivation.
	Maintain the physical appearance and operational efficiency of the hotel including physical, mechanical, electrical, plumbing etc.


What are we looking for?


	A Chief Engineer serving Hilton brands is always working on behalf of our Guests and working with other Team Members.


Qualifications
To successfully fill this role, you should maintain the attitude, behaviours, skills, and values that follow:


	A Master`s degree in Engineering or similar
	Advanced knowledge of building management/engineering
	Exposure to budgeting and basic accounting
	Positive attitude
	Good communication skills
	Committed to delivering a high level of customer service
	Strong leadership skills and previous experience of managing a team
	Excellent grooming standards
	Flexibility to respond to a range of different work situations
	Ability to work under pressure
	Ability to work on their own
	Previous experience of facilities management
	Proficient, at an advanced level, with computers and relevant computer programs.


It would be advantageous in this position for you to demonstrate the following capabilities and distinctions:


	Diploma CFPA Europe Fire Safety
	Certified Engineering Operation Executive (CEOE)
	Master Certificate in Applied Project Management
	Certificate in Advance Strategic Project Management Practices.
    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Loan Officer",
  "description": "At TeamAce, we help businesses across different industries thrive. We work with businesses to create their desired change by getting the right people, designing bespoke business processes, leveraging data, applying insights and technology. We combine our expertise and take different bespoke approaches to solve different business challenges because we believe there is no one size fits all approach. This way, you keep your eyes on the price and thrive.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Loan Officer
Job Locations:&nbsp;Iyana Iba, Obalende, Ikorodu &amp; Ota - Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are currently seeking experienced professionals for a Portfolio Manager position with our team, and we believe your background and experience could make you an excellent fit.
	As a Loan Officer, you will report directly to a Team Manager, overseeing a large customer portfolio to ensure minimal risk and effective loan recovery.
	Your key responsibilities will include:


Responsibilities


	Marketing financial products to potential clients.
	Conducting pre-loanassessments and preparing necessaryloandocuments.
	Monitoring repayments and managingloanrecovery processes.
	Ensuring proper portfolio transfer upon exit; failure to do so may lead to prosecution.
	This role requires a high level of integrity, attention to detail, and the ability to work outdoors when necessary.


Requirements


	Education: A minimum of OND or HND in accounting, finance, or related fields.
	Prior experience as a Loan Officer with a Microfinance Bank/Outfit is required.
	Sales Experience: While not mandatory, sales experience or training is preferred.


Salary
N80,000 - N100,000 Monthly, commensurate with experience.",
  "datePosted": "2025-09-02",
  "validThrough": "2025-10-03",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "TeamAce"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {

      "addressCountry": "NG"

    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",
    "currency": "NGN",

      "minValue": 75000,
      "maxValue": 150000,
      "unitText": "MONTH"
    }
  }
}



Loan Officer Job at TeamAce




        
    

        
        At TeamAce, we help businesses across different industries thrive. We work with businesses to create their desired change by getting the right people, designing bespoke business processes, leveraging data, applying insights and technology. We combine our expertise and take different bespoke approaches to solve different business challenges because we believe there is no one size fits all approach. This way, you keep your eyes on the price and thrive.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Loan Officer
Job Locations: Iyana Iba, Obalende, Ikorodu & Ota - Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	We are currently seeking experienced professionals for a Portfolio Manager position with our team, and we believe your background and experience could make you an excellent fit.
	As a Loan Officer, you will report directly to a Team Manager, overseeing a large customer portfolio to ensure minimal risk and effective loan recovery.
	Your key responsibilities will include:


Responsibilities


	Marketing financial products to potential clients.
	Conducting pre-loanassessments and preparing necessaryloandocuments.
	Monitoring repayments and managingloanrecovery processes.
	Ensuring proper portfolio transfer upon exit; failure to do so may lead to prosecution.
	This role requires a high level of integrity, attention to detail, and the ability to work outdoors when necessary.


Requirements


	Education: A minimum of OND or HND in accounting, finance, or related fields.
	Prior experience as a Loan Officer with a Microfinance Bank/Outfit is required.
	Sales Experience: While not mandatory, sales experience or training is preferred.


Salary
N80,000 - N100,000 Monthly, commensurate with experience.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Developer II",
  "description": "ABNL Limited was incorporated in 1992 as an Oil and Gas servicing company with a vision to provide professional engineering and technical services to the Oil and Gas exploration and production companies in Nigeria and the West African sub-region. Since its incorporation, the company has grown in leaps and bounds, expanding its business horizon, but still within the Oil and Gas sector.

ABNL is a 100% owned indigenous firm, with a shareholding in excess of 100 million Naira. Its&#39; directors are individuals of proven integrity, who over the years have acquired the requisite experience in the Oil and Gas business, as well as in the banking and finance sector. The integrity of the directors and the staff of the company have been a priceless contributive factor in the growth and wellbeing of the company.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Developer II

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos&nbsp;
Employment Type: Contract

Main Functions


	Responsible for the design, development, and maintenance of software applications across a broad&nbsp;technology portfolio.
	Supports testing, debugging, and refining the applications to produce the required&nbsp;product.
	Devises and provides programming solution approaches to problems and issues.
	Helps prepare&nbsp;both program-level and user-level documentation.
	Works with moderate work direction and is skilled&nbsp;and knowledgeable in the position.
	This position would typically include a senior Developer who is able to perform tasks of high complexity and difficulty.
	Such an individual could also manage and train other team members and lead projects.


Skills and Qualifications


	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor&#39;s / Master&#39;s Degree with 8-24 years of work experience.
	Proficiency in project-specific tools, applications and languages. Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC) experience.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Resume (MS Word) format to:&nbsp;jobs@abnl.net&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",
  "datePosted": "2025-09-02",
  "validThrough": "2025-09-10",

Developer II Job at ABNL Limited




        
    

        
        ABNL Limited was incorporated in 1992 as an Oil and Gas servicing company with a vision to provide professional engineering and technical services to the Oil and Gas exploration and production companies in Nigeria and the West African sub-region. Since its incorporation, the company has grown in leaps and bounds, expanding its business horizon, but still within the Oil and Gas sector.
     

            
    



ABNL is a 100% owned indigenous firm, with a shareholding in excess of 100 million Naira. Its' directors are individuals of proven integrity, who over the years have acquired the requisite experience in the Oil and Gas business, as well as in the banking and finance sector. The integrity of the directors and the staff of the company have been a priceless contributive factor in the growth and wellbeing of the company.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Developer II

Job Location: Lagos 
Employment Type: Contract

Main Functions


	Responsible for the design, development, and maintenance of software applications across a broad technology portfolio.
	Supports testing, debugging, and refining the applications to produce the required product.
	Devises and provides programming solution approaches to problems and issues.
	Helps prepare both program-level and user-level documentation.
	Works with moderate work direction and is skilled and knowledgeable in the position.
	This position would typically include a senior Developer who is able to perform tasks of high complexity and difficulty.
	Such an individual could also manage and train other team members and lead projects.


Skills and Qualifications


	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor's / Master's Degree with 8-24 years of work experience.
	Proficiency in project-specific tools, applications and languages. Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC) experience.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Resume (MS Word) format to: jobs@abnl.net using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
